title: 105_hr3143
content: The Act is titled the "Comprehensive Holocaust Accountability in Insurance Measure." Title I includes provisions applicable to certain foreign insurance companies, with Section 101 outlining a prohibition. Foreign insurance companies listed in subsection (b) are prohibited from conducting business in the United States if they have had financial dealings with individuals on Holocaust survivor lists. The listed companies include Assicurazioni Generali S.p.A., Union Des Assurances de Paris, Victoria Lebenversicherungs AG, Winterthur Lebensversicherungs Gesellschaft, Allianz Lebensversicherungs AG, and Wiener Allianz Versicherungs AG. Foreign insurance companies listed in subsection (b) are prohibited from conducting business in the United States if they have had financial dealings with individuals on Holocaust survivor lists. The Attorney General will designate an office in the Department of Justice for disclosures to be made in accordance with the regulations. The Attorney General will designate an office in the Department of Justice for disclosures related to Holocaust survivor lists to be made and available to the public. TITLE II--PROVISIONS APPLICABLE TO UNITED STATES BANKING INSTITUTIONS: LIMITATION ON INSURED DEPOSITORY INSTITUTIONS. Prohibition on transactions with certain insurance companies or their affiliates by insured depository institutions under Section 18 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act. The Limited exception for affiliates allows for the payment of dividends on shares of stock in an insured depository institution held by a foreign insurance company or its affiliate, and the investment of additional capital. The limited exception for affiliates allows for the payment of dividends on shares of stock in an insured depository institution held by a foreign insurance company or its affiliate, and the investment of additional capital, subject to regulations set by the Attorney General or the appropriate Federal banking agency. SEC. 202 limits uninsured branches, agencies, and commercial lending company affiliates of foreign banks. Section 7 of the International Banking Act of 1978 is amended to prohibit transactions with certain insurance companies or their affiliates by branches, agencies, or commercial lending companies controlled by foreign banks. This includes restrictions on accepting deposits, providing payment services, participating in payment systems, extending credit, or engaging in financial activities with specified foreign insurance companies or their affiliates. The Attorney General can restrict transactions with certain insurance companies or their affiliates by branches, agencies, or commercial lending companies controlled by foreign banks. This restriction includes prohibiting dividends payment on shares held by the foreign insurance company or its affiliates. The Attorney General can restrict transactions with insurance companies or affiliates by foreign banks, including prohibiting dividends on shares held by the foreign insurance company or its affiliates. Payments or investments in branches, agencies, or companies must comply with regulations set by regulatory bodies.
